tutorials.title: Step-by-step tutorials
tutorials.subtitle: Learn how to use Waze in Gabon with our practical guides adapted to the local context.
tutorials.install.title: Install Waze
tutorials.install.subtitle: Download and first launch
tutorials.install.step1.title: Download the app
tutorials.install.step1.desc: Open the App Store (iPhone) or Google Play (Android). Search for "Waze" and tap Install. The app is 100% free.
tutorials.install.step2.title: Allow location access
tutorials.install.step2.desc: On first launch, Waze asks for GPS access. Choose "Always Allow" so navigation works even in the background.
tutorials.install.step3.title: Create your account
tutorials.install.step3.desc: Tap "Sign up". You can use your email, Google or Facebook account. Choose a unique username.
tutorials.install.step4.title: Enable mobile data
tutorials.install.step4.desc: Waze requires internet (Airtel, Moov Africa). Usage: 10-30 MB/hour. Turn on Wi-Fi when available to save data.
tutorials.profile.title: Customize your profile
tutorials.profile.subtitle: Avatar, name and preferences
tutorials.profile.step1.title: Access settings
tutorials.profile.step1.desc: Tap the search icon (magnifying glass) at the bottom, then tap your avatar at the top left to open My Waze.
tutorials.profile.step2.title: Change your avatar (Mood)
tutorials.profile.step2.desc: In My Waze, tap your car icon. Choose from available Moods. Some are unlocked by driving!
tutorials.profile.step3.title: Edit your name
tutorials.profile.step3.desc: Go to Settings > Account. You can change your display name visible to other Wazers.
tutorials.profile.step4.title: Choose your vehicle
tutorials.profile.step4.desc: In Settings > Vehicle type, select your vehicle. This affects route calculation (narrow roads, tolls, etc.).
tutorials.places.title: Save your places
tutorials.places.subtitle: Home, work and favorites
tutorials.places.step1.title: Save your home
tutorials.places.step1.desc: Tap the magnifying glass > Favorites > Home. Enter your address or position the cursor on the map. Waze will calculate your daily commute.
tutorials.places.step2.title: Save your workplace
tutorials.places.step2.desc: Same process: Favorites > Work. Waze will automatically suggest the best route every morning.
tutorials.places.step3.title: Add favorites
tutorials.places.step3.desc: After each address search, tap the star to add it to favorites. Handy for frequent places: school, gym, family.
tutorials.places.step4.title: Enjoy suggestions
tutorials.places.step4.desc: Waze learns your habits. It automatically suggests your home-to-work route with the ideal departure time based on traffic!
tutorials.navigate.title: Plan your trips
tutorials.navigate.subtitle: Arrival time, departure and alternatives
tutorials.navigate.step1.title: Start navigation
tutorials.navigate.step1.desc: Tap the magnifying glass, enter your destination and tap "Go". Waze calculates the best real-time route.
tutorials.navigate.step2.title: Plan a future trip
tutorials.navigate.step2.desc: Tap the magnifying glass > Plan a drive. Choose a desired arrival date and time. Waze will tell you when to leave!
tutorials.navigate.step3.title: Compare routes
tutorials.navigate.step3.desc: Before departing, Waze shows 2-3 alternative routes with estimated time. Swipe to see each one on the map.
tutorials.navigate.step4.title: Add a stop
tutorials.navigate.step4.desc: During navigation, tap the arrow > Add a stop. Handy for the gas station or dropping someone off along the way.
tutorials.report.title: Report on the road
tutorials.report.subtitle: Real-time community alerts
tutorials.report.step1.title: Open the report menu
tutorials.report.step1.desc: During navigation, tap the orange bubble icon at the bottom right. This is the quick report button.
tutorials.report.step2.title: Choose the type
tutorials.report.step2.desc: Traffic jam, accident, police, hazard, road closed, fuel price. Choose the matching category.
tutorials.report.step3.title: Add details
tutorials.report.step3.desc: For traffic: light, moderate or heavy. For hazards: on the road or on the shoulder. The more precise, the more helpful!
tutorials.report.step4.title: Confirm others' alerts
tutorials.report.step4.desc: When you see an alert on the map, tap it then tap the thumbs up to confirm. This helps Waze validate the information.
tutorials.editor.title: Edit the map
tutorials.editor.subtitle: Help improve Waze maps in Gabon
tutorials.editor.step1.title: Access the editor
tutorials.editor.step1.desc: Go to waze.com/editor from a computer. Sign in with your Waze account. The editor shows the editable map.
tutorials.editor.step2.title: Navigate to Gabon
tutorials.editor.step2.desc: Search for "Libreville" in the search bar. Zoom into neighborhoods you know well.
tutorials.editor.step3.title: Add roads
tutorials.editor.step3.desc: Click the Road button (shortcut: I). Trace the road point by point. Name it correctly. Save.
tutorials.editor.step4.title: Fix errors
tutorials.editor.step4.desc: Misplaced roads, incorrect names, wrong traffic direction — every correction improves Waze for all Gabonese drivers.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.q1.question: Is Waze free in Gabon?
faq.q1.answer: Yes, Waze is 100% free worldwide, including in Gabon. No subscription, no hidden fees. You just need an internet connection (Airtel or Moov Africa mobile data).
faq.q2.question: How does Waze work in Libreville?
faq.q2.answer: Waze uses GPS data from all connected drivers to calculate the fastest real-time routes. The more Wazers in Libreville, the more accurate the data. That's why your participation matters!
faq.q3.question: How do I report a traffic jam?
faq.q3.answer: During navigation, tap the orange bubble icon at the bottom right, then select "Traffic jam". Choose the intensity (light, moderate, heavy) and confirm. Other Wazers will be alerted instantly.
faq.q4.question: Does Waze work offline?
faq.q4.answer: Waze requires an internet connection for route calculation and real-time alerts. However, if you lose connection during a trip, navigation continues with the last calculated route. Data usage: 10-30 MB/hour.
faq.q5.question: How do I become a map editor?
faq.q5.answer: Create a Waze account, then access waze.com/editor from a computer. You can immediately start adding roads and fixing errors in your neighborhood. Changes are reviewed by the community before publication.
faq.q6.question: Are fuel prices useful on Waze in Gabon?
faq.q6.answer: In Gabon, fuel prices are set by the government and are the same at all stations. Waze's price feature is therefore less relevant here. However, Waze remains very useful for locating the nearest gas stations on your route.
faq.q7.question: How do I install Waze on CarPlay / Android Auto?
faq.q7.answer: Install Waze on your phone, then connect it to your vehicle via USB or Bluetooth. Waze will automatically appear on the dashboard screen. Compatible with most recent vehicles.

privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.intro: Waze Gabon Club is an independent community project. We respect your privacy.
privacy.collected: Data collected: name, email and Waze username (optional), only if you fill out the registration form.
privacy.purpose: Purpose: to welcome you into the community and invite you to our channels (WhatsApp, Telegram, Facebook).
privacy.thirdParty: Third-party services: the form is processed by Formspree (USA). Fonts are loaded via Google Fonts. The live map is provided by Waze (Google).
privacy.notCollected: What we do NOT collect: no cookies, no GPS location, no Waze navigation data, no analytics.
privacy.localStorage: Local storage: only your language preference (FR/EN) is saved in your browser.
privacy.contact: Contact: for any questions, reach out via our WhatsApp group or Facebook page.
